result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Motion hearing on January 5, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
of INIT on 1/10/22 - HDavis
and Offer of Proof to Admit Recorded Statement of Children at Trial
of Intent to Introduce Statement, Confession Or Admission
Cover Letter from Atty. Van Wagner for transcript

Final pre-trial on April 10, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Motion hearing on April 10, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Hearing on April 10, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on May 1, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Telephone scheduling conference on August 17, 2022 at 08:15 am.

11:33 AM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert L Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner in court for Robert L Perkins.  Court states case and appearances.  State notes victim notification requirements have been met.  Atty Van Wagner acknowledges rec. information and waives reading and stands mute to all charges.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties and enters NG pleas.  Court notes matter will be set for TSC in about 60 days.  Counsel to receive notice once it's set.  Bond continued.

10:35 AM Prosecuting attorney Emily Eklund in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Robert L Perkins in court, in custody.  Attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner in court for Robert L Perkins.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes she set this to go until 2pm today so there is ample time to complete today's hearing.  Atty Van Wagner asks for clarification re: a witness the State may call.  Court responds that she cannot make that decision at this point.  Atty Van Wagner responds re: hearsay.  State calls Det. Drew Bulin - SCSD - S&T.  Witness ID's DE.  Record to reflect ID.  Atty Van Wagner has no questions.  Witness excused and neither party has an further witnesses.  Recess for 5 minutes at 11:03 a.m.  Back on the record at 11:14 a.m.  Court notes State is still wishing to proceed and addresses objections made by Atty Van Wagner and addresses the motion for STD testing.  Court addresses bodily fluids and whether that was presented during testimony today.  State responds.  Atty Van Wagner responds.  Court finds probable cause and binds DE over.  At this point the Court does not find that at this point the State has not met their burden re: the STD testing but notes that right has not been waived by the State.  State is not ready to proceed to arraignment at this time.  Atty Van Wagner responds re: the Court's ruling as to the STD statute ruling and references 3(c).  Court sets ARGN date.  Bond continued.
Arraignment scheduled for June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Arraignment on June 16, 2022 at 11:30 am.
to Br. 3 from ADA Eklund regarding STD/HIV testing
Motion hearing on June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on June 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.
from Atty Van Wagner to Br 3
from Atty Van Wagner to Judge Barrett
for STD/HIV Testing
Preliminary hearing on May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.

01:14 PM Defendant Robert L Perkins in court with attorney Christopher T. Van Wagner.  Defendant Robert L Perkins in custody.  Gabriel David Arevalo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Van Wagner received a copy of the Amended Criminal Complaint.  DE advised of charges and penalties.  Bond continues.  Atty Van Wagner received discovery but has not had a chance to review all of it.  Requests a reset.  Matter reset.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 19, 2022 at 11:00 am.
and Defense Motion for Additional Time to File Pre-Trial Motions

01:59 PM Defendant Robert L Perkins in court, in custody.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court states case and appearances.  Court notes DE previously didn't qualify for PD appt.  DE still doesn't have counsel - they have one in line but need time to get the retainer together.  Court reminds DE of upcoming court dates.

Status conference on January 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference on March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Return date on March 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

03:40 PM Defendant Robert L Perkins in court, in custody from LEC w/atty. Hayes.  Emily Eklund appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert L Perkins appeared by video means.  Defendant received and waives reading of complaint.  Court advises DE of charges/max penalties. DE does not qualify for PD representation.  Advised of rights to an attorney. State requests $500,000 Cash bond w/conditions.  Atty. Hayes makes bail arugment, no argument to conditions.  Time limits waived for preliminary hearing.  $100,000.00 CASH bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows: No contact w/E.R.B. or father (G.A.B.) of E.R.B.; No contact with Al Burman Elementary school in Baraboo; No contact, except incidental, w/anyone under the age of 18.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2022 at 01:00 pm.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 10:00 am.  Return date scheduled for March 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
